Description: DESCRIPTION:THE INTERNATIONAL NEUROTOXICOLOGY ASSOCIATION (INA) CONVENTION WILL BRING TOGETHER RESEARCH SCIENTISTS FROM AROUND THE WORLD TO PRESENT THEIR LATEST RESEARCH CONCERNING THE FUNCTIONAL NEUROTOXICOLOGICAL EFFECTS AND THE MECHANISMS OF THOSE EFFECTS. ACTIVITIES:THE OBJECTIVES AND RESULTS OF THE MEETING ARE TO COMMUNICATE THE LATEST ADVANCES IN NEUROTOXICOLOGY, EXCHANGE EXPERTISE AND IDEAS, DEVELOP SCIENTIFIC RELATIONSHIPS AND COLLABORATIONS, IMPROVE INCLUSIVENESS AND EQUITY, AND ADVANCE THE CAREERS OF JUNIOR SCIENTISTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE A FINAL REPORT. IN ADDITION, THE RESULTS OF THE INA CONVENTION WILL BE PUBLISHED IN PEER REVIEWED JOURNALS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE JUNIOR RESEARCHERS, SCIENTISTS, AND THE OTHER PARTICIPANTS WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE CONTRIBUTIONS OF THE STUDENTS AND POST-DOCTORAL TRAINEES.

TO ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH PROBLEMS FACED BY STATE AND TERRITORIAL HEALTH AGENCIES (STHA). ASTHO'S WORK WILL COVER VARIOUS AREAS THAT ADVANCE THE PRIORITIES OF BOTH ASTHO AND EPA, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO WATER SAFETY, CHILDREN'S ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH, RESILIENCE TO POLLUTANTS AND RELATED EFFECTS STEMMING FROM NATURAL AND MAN-MADE DISASTERS, AIR QUALITY, LEAD, CONTAMINANTS OF EMERGING CONCERN, AND COVID 19.

THIS IS IN SUPPORT OF THE TOXICOLOGY FORUM CONFERENCE ON ASSESSING CARCINOGENICITY: HAZARD INFORMATION, CLASSIFICATION AND RISK ASSESSMENT FROM DECEMBER 7TH-10TH, 2020. THE CONFERENCE PROVIDES A FORUM WHERE SCIENTISTS, MANAGERS, AND OTHER PROFESSIONALS EXCHANGE INFORMATION AND IDEAS ON THE LONG-STANDING TESTING METHODS AND RISK ASSESSMENT APPROACHES WITH REGARDS TO CARCINOGENICITY.

THIS IS IN SUPPORT OF THE SOCIETY OF TOXICOLOGY (SOT) CONTEMPORARY CONCEPTS IN TOXICOLOGY (CCT) CONFERENCE, FUTURE TOX V: NEW TECHNOLOGIES TO EVALUATE ORGAN-SPECIFIC EFFECTS FOR DRUGS AND CHEMICALS WHICH WILL BE HELD IN NOVEMBER, 2021. THE CONFERENCE WILL PROVIDE A FORUM WHERE SCIENTIST, MANAGERS AND OTHER PROFESSIONALS EXCHANGE INFORMATION AND IDEAS TO TRANSLATE TOXICOLOGY TESTING IN THE 21ST CENTURY APPROACHES INTO CHEMICAL RISK ASSESSMENT. THE CONFERENCE WILL BE HELD AT THE FRIDAY CONFERENCE CENTER AT THE UNIVERSITY OF NORTH CAROLINA IN CHAPEL HILL, NC. APPROXIMATELY 300 SCIENTISTS FROM DIVERSE SECTORS ARE ANTICIPATED TO ATTEND THIS CONFERENCE. THE PRINCIPLE OUTCOME WILL BE THE NUMBER OF REGISTRANTS AND POSTERS PRESENTED BY YOUNG AND EARLY CAREER SCIENTISTS. PUBLICATION OF CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS IS ANOTHER ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF THE MEETING, AS HAS BEEN DONE IN THE PAST.

THE PROJECT'S AIM IS TO FOSTER SCIENTIFICALLY INFORMED, EVIDENCE-BASED POLICY AND PRACTICE BY INVOLVING SCIENTISTS AND ENGINEERS FROM A BROAD RANGE OF DISCIPLINES, BACKGROUNDS AND CAREER STAGES TO CONTRIBUTE THEIR RESEARCH, KNOWLEDGE AND ANALYTICAL SKILLS TO LEARN FIRST-HAND ABOUT POLICYMAKING AND IMPLEMENTATION AT THE FEDERAL LEVEL AND TO BUILD LEADERSHIP FOR A STRONG SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY ENTERPRISE THAT BENEFITS SOCIETY.

THE PROJECT'S AIM IS TO FOSTER SCIENTIFICALLY INFORMED, EVIDENCE-BASED POLICY AND PRACTICE BY INVOLVING SCIENTISTS AND ENGINEERS FROM A BROAD RANGE OF DISCIPLINES, BACKGROUNDS AND CAREER STAGES TO CONTRIBUTE THEIR RESEARCH, KNOWLEDGE AND ANALYTICAL SKILLS TO LEARN FIRST-HAND ABOUT POLICYMAKING AND IMPLEMENTATION AT THE FEDERAL LEVEL AND TO BUILD LEADERSHIP FOR A STRONG SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY ENTERPRISE THAT BENEFITS SOCIETY.

THIS IS IN SUPPORT OF THE SOCIETY OF ENVIRONMENTAL TOXICOLOGY AND CHEMISTRY (SETAC) FOCUS TOPIC MEETING(FTM) AND WORKSHOP ON ESTIMATING ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARD AND RISKS FROM EXPOSURE TO PERFLUORINATED AND POLYFLUORINATED ALKYL SUBSTANCES (PFAS) AUGUST 12-15, 2019. THE SOCIETY PROVIDES A FORUM WHERE SCIENTISTS, MANAGERS, AND OTHER PROFESSIONALS EXCHANGE INFORMATION AND IDEAS FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND USE OF MULTIDISCIPLINARY SCIENTIFIC PRINCIPLES AND PRACTICES LEADING TO SUSTAINABLE ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY

THE GORDON RESEARCH CONFERENCE IS A NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO CONDUCTING CONFERENCES: 1) TO ASSEMBLE A DIVERSE GROUP OF SCIENTISTS WITH INTEREST IN THE FIELD OF TOXICOLOGY FOR A HIGHLY INTERACTIVE AND FOCUSED CONFERENCE HIGHLIGHTING THE LATEST FINDINGS AND CONCEPTS RELATED TO THE UNDERSTANDING OF CELLULAR AND MOLECULAR MECHANISMS OF TOXICITY; 2) TO CREATE A FORUM THAT FOSTERS DIALOG, NETWORKING, AND IDEA SHARING; AND 3) ENCOURAGE AND MENTOR NEW TRAINEES ON PATHWAYS TO SUCCESSFUL CAREERS IN THE VARIOUS DISCIPLINES EMBRACED BY TOXICOLOGY THROUGH THE GORDON RESEARCH SEMINAR.

THE CITIZEN SCIENCE ASSOCIATION WILL HOLD ITS THIRD BIENNIAL CONFERENCE, CITSCI2019. THIS PROJECT WILL HELP THE FIELD OF CITIZEN SCIENCE CONTINUE TO GROW AND MATURE TO HELP ACHIEVE SCIENTIFIC, ENVIRONMENTAL, AND SOCIAL OUTCOMES. THE CONFERENCE WILL HELP TRANSFORM SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AND LEARNING, BROADEN PARTICIPATION IN SCIENCE AND ADDRESS KEY SCIENTIFIC CHALLENGES.

THIS IS IN SUPPORT OF A GORDON RESEARCH CONFERENCE ON DRINKING WATER DISINFECTION BY-PRODUCTS. THE CONFERENCE IS TAKING PLACE AT MOUNT HOLYOKE COLLEGE IN SOUTH HADLEY, MA, ON JULY 27-AUG. 2, 2019. THE CONFERENCE PROVIDES A VENUE FOR SESSIONS THAT ADDRESSES VITALLY IMPORTANT ISSUES CONFRONTING SCIENTISTS, ENGINEERS, WATER UTILITIES, INDUSTRY GROUPS, AND PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS IN THE PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF HIGH QUALITY POTABLE WATER.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES WITHIN EPA PROGRAM OFFICES FOR EARLY CAREER PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS WHO HAVE GRADUATED FROM ASPPH-MEMBER, COUNCIL ON EDUCATION FOR PUBLIC HEALTH (CEPH)-ACCREDITED GRADUATE SCHOOLS OF PUBLIC HEALTH. DURING THESE PLACEMENTS, FELLOWS WILL GAIN PRACTICE-BASED PROFESSIONAL LEARNING EXPERIENCES AND PERFORM ACTIVITIES UNDER THE MENTORSHIP OF EPA PROGRAM OFFICES IN THE FIELD OF ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH AND SCIENCE POLICY.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR EARLY CAREER PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS WHO HAVE GRADUATED FROM ASPPH-MEMBER, COUNCIL ON EDUCATION FOR PUBLIC HEALTH (CEPH)-ACCREDITED GRADUATE SCHOOLS OF PUBLIC HEALTH. DURING THESE PLACEMENTS, FELLOWS WILL GAIN PRACTICE-BASED PROFESSIONAL LEARNING EXPERIENCES AND PERFORM ACTIVITIES UNDER THE MENTORSHIP OF EPA EXPERTS IN THE FIELD OF ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH AND ITS INTERFACE WITH POLICY, SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY.
EPA IS PROVIDING FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO THE NELAC INSTITUTE (TNI) TO MANAGE THE NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING CONFERENCE (NEMC) AS PART OF THE ENVI
THE PROPOSED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL PLACE PROFESSIONAL SCIENTISTS AND ENGINEERS IN EPA FOR ONE TO TWO YEAR FELLOWSHIPS. DURING THESE PLACEMENTS,
THE OVERALL GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CREATE A CONSTANTLY UPGRADING, FLEXIBLE AND EASILY REPRODUCIBLE LIVING LABORATORY TO PILOT SUSTAINABILITY TOOL
